summary: Emilia-Romagna is a region in northern Italy, made up of Emilia and Romagna. Its capital is Bologna. With an area of 22,446 km2 and a population of 4.4 million, it's one of Europe's wealthiest areas. Known for its culture, economy, and tourism, it's home to the world's oldest university and cities like Modena and Parma. The region has 11 UNESCO sites, is a hub for food and car production (including Ferrari and Lamborghini), and has popular beach resorts like Rimini. In 2018, it was named Europe's top travel destination by Lonely Planet.
title: Emilia-Romagna
